title: KentuckianaCross Round #4
description: Grass roots cyclocross racing continues at Angel Mounds Historic Site in Evansville Indiana. Visit our website for more information.
course: 1.5 miles of double track, single track, and fun flowing cross styled course.

title: Rockport Rampage II
description: The final round of the Kentuckiana Cyclocross Series. The second race held at Rockport City Park, Rockport Rampage II.
course: 1.9 miles of grass, sand, gravel, pavement with a variety of off camber, elevation change, and man made obstacles.
registration: Please visit www.usacycling.org to register online. Day of registration is available.
notes: Equal payout to Men and Women Elite Riders. Merchandise for all others. Event will happen rain or shine.
directions:
From Louisville- Travel 64 West, Exit at 57B, travel south on 231, exit at Rockport, IN. Following Hwy 66 to the intersection of 5th St. Continue straight onto 5th Street, turn right onto Main, and follow Main Street into the City Park.
From St. Louis- Travel 64 East, Exit at 57B, travel south on 231, exit at Rockport, IN. Following Hwy 66 to the intersection of 5th St. Continue straight onto 5th Street, turn right onto Main, and follow Main Street into the City Park.

title: Scholars Inn Bakehouse Bloomington Criterium
description: The Tour of Bloomington Criterium be held on Saturday May 2nd and the road race on Sunday May 3rd, 2015 in Bloomington, Indiana.  Bloomington has a rich and prolific history of bike racing bolstered by its connection to the legendary Indiana University’s Little 500 held the weekend before. For well over a decade, the city has welcomed bike racing in the heart of its award-winning, bicycle friendly downtown, hosting hundreds of racers as they speed past familiar landmarks on Kirkwood Avenue and through our beautiful parks and natural attractions.  Join us for this free-to-the public, high performance weekend event bringing the best competitive cycling talent to Bloomington.
course: The Tour of Bloomington criterium is a short 7/10 mile, fast, several lap event held on a closed loop on and around Bloomington’s bustling cultural district of East Kirkwood Avenue.  The races start at 2:00 p.m. and last through 8:00 p.m. with the racers passing by every 2 minutes!  We expect hundreds of racers and a thousand spectators lining the streets in support of this community event.
registration:
Register online at www.bikereg.com
Race day registration opens at 12:00 noon and closes 30 minutes prior to each event" 
Second race is $20
One-day licenses are $15 and are only available to cat 5 men, cat 4 women, and juniors. Licenses can be purchased online, or on the day of the race.
notes: Visit www.tourofbloomigton.org for additional information, or www.scholarsinncycling.org.
directions: Visit www.tourofbloomigton.org for additional information and directions to the race venue.  The start/finish area is on E. Kirkwood Avenue in downtown Bloomington, Indiana.

title: Scholars Inn Bakehouse Bloomington Road Race
description:
The Tour of Bloomington powered by the Scholars Inn Bakehouse
The Tour of Bloomington will be held on Saturday May 2nd and Sunday May 3rd, 2015 in Bloomington, Indiana.  Bloomington has a rich and prolific history of bike racing bolstered by its connection to the legendary Indiana University’s Little 500 held the weekend before. For well over a decade, the city has welcomed bike racing in the heart of its award-winning, bicycle friendly downtown, hosting hundreds of racers as they speed past familiar landmarks on Kirkwood Avenue and through our beautiful parks and natural attractions.  Join us for this free-to-the public, high performance weekend event bringing the best competitive cycling talent to Bloomington.
course: The 2015 Tour of Bloomington consists of two races; the downtown Bloomington Criterium on Saturday and the Morgan Monroe State Forest Road Race on Sunday.   The Morgan Monroe State Forest Road Race is an epic 14 mile, counterclockwise loop on Anderson Road, up Beanblossom Road, the Forest Road and Old State Road 37.   Watch these racers battle it out on one of the toughest road courses in the MidWest!
registration:
Go to www.bikereg.com for registration information or visit www.scholarsinncycling.org.  
Race day registration opens at 8:30 am and closes 30 minutes prior to each event.
One-Day licenses are $15, and are only available for cat 5 men, cat 4 women, and juniors. Licenses can be purchased online, or on race day.
notes:
There will be a feed zone for the Master's event on Lap 2, for the Men's Pro/1/2/3 on Laps 2, 3, and 4, and the Women's Pro/1/2/3 on Lap 2. 
The feed zone will be located and clearly marked just prior to the finish line.  Parking areas on the course will be established only for feed zone personnel.
The yellow line rule will be strictly enforced. The road course is not closed and is open to traffic. Even when no line is apparent all riders are expected to stay in their own lane.
Please do not park on the road course.
directions: From the North on Route 37 get off on Old State Road 37, travel south to the Morgan Monroe State Forest entrance.  Parking is along this stretch of Old State Road 37.  After parking, you may ride your bike the 2.5 miles to registration by turning left on Forest Road (you are now on the course going against the direction of the race). Travel to the intersection at Beanblossom road to registration. From the South on 37 North, get off on the Route 45/46 exit to Bloomington. Take a left onto the Walnut Street Extension and a right on Old State Road 37. Travel North for approximately 5 miles and continue past Anderson Road (you are now on the course, traveling in the opposite direction of the race). Once at the top of the climb, continue straight past the entrance to the Morgan-Monroe State Forest to roadside parking. Please do not park on the road course.

title: SRAM DINO Mountain Bike Series - Winona Lake
CX duathlon
description: Super Sprint Cyclo-Cross Duathlon consists of a 1.5 mile run on mixed terrain, a 5 mile (5 x 1 mile loop) cyclocross course, and a 1.5 mile run to finish.  Visit TriStateTriathlon.org
course: The run starts on the muddy banks of the St. Marys River, through the trees, up the hill and takes on the paved River Greenway.  This out and back 1.5 mile run has an aid station at the turn-around.  The cyclocross loop contains steep hills, sharp turns, a flyover, rail road ties, much grass, a little dirt, and maybe some mud.  Each loop is timed with ITS proprietary equipment, providing average speed, rank, and progress through the course.  In and out of Transition on the bike is via smooth 'round-a-bout' curve, where laps are announced.  Visit Tristatetriathlon.org
notes: Mountian bikes, cyclocross bikes, bmx bikes are welcome.  Road bikes should have off road tires to maintain control.  Beginners, keep to the right and allow CX veterans to pass.  Be courteous and maintain control.
directions:
Use google maps or navigation system to locate:
Parking: Ream-Steckbeck Paint Co, 200 West Superior St, Fort Wayne, IN 46802
Take the beautiful bridge across to Fort Wayne Outfitters Depot.  If unsure, use your GPS again to walk/ride to:
Fort Wayne Oufitters and Bike Depot, 1004 Cass St., Fort Wayne, IN 46808

Indy Criterium Cycling Race & Festival
description:
The 6th annual Indy Criterium is sure to challenge the racers and thrill the spectators. Situated in the heart of Downtown Indianapolis, the Indy Crit offers cyclists a unique opportunity to race the city streets that they would rarely ride otherwise. The previous three years have drawn over 500 racers from across the Midwest!!  Be a part of the fun and excitement of Indiana's largest criterium race!

Fees: See fee schedule below.  $20/additional race

Event Address: 1 Monument Circle, Indianapolis, IN  46204

Onsite Pre-Registration opens at 8:00am.

Race Highlights:

* $7,200 in overall CASH Prize Purse & Primes ($6,200 cash purse & $1,000 cash primes)
* Over $4,000 in MERCHANDISE Prizes
* Midwest Junior Regional Criterium Championship 
* Podium ceremony on stage for all categories
* Call-ups for first 20 pre-registered in each category
* Unique figure-8 course in the heart of the city
* Neutral Race Support provided by Michael Kubansek (Marian University Cycling) - wheels in/wheels out
* Pre-Registration Contest:  Zipp 303 Firecrest Wheels ($2,725 value), SILCA Superpista Ultimate Floor Pump ($450 value) 
* Free swag at Registration table

Festival Highlights:
* Food, Beer Garden, Vendors, Music
* Marian University & TruTrainer Pre-Race Warm-Up Tent (why bring your trainer - warm up here!)
* SILCA Inflation Station (find your perfect tire pressure pre-race here!)
* BMX Stunt Shows
* Morning Franciscan St. Francis Health Indy Crit Kick-Off Ride (14 / 32 / 52 mi)
* Freewheelin' Family Fun Ride (1 / 3 mile)
* Kids Races
* Rolls-Royce Race with the Mayor
* IU Health Kids Zone Activities
* Free bike parking at the IndyGo Pedal & Park!

The Indy Criterium is an official non-profit 501(c)3 event. All event proceeds benefit Freewheelin' Community Bikes. Over $48,000 has been raised for Freewheelin' through the Indy Criterium! A HUGE thanks to our racers, sponsors and fans!
course:
NEW Start/Finish location and course direction for 2015!  The Indy Criterium will feature the same popular course but we are moving the start/finish line and festivities down to Monument Circle.  The direction of the course will run clockwise, allowing for a long, sprint finish towards the monument. Smooth safe, pavement conditions.

Course Description: 
* Flat, smooth, wide course in urban downtown Indy setting.
* 0.95 mile closed course / wide lanes / flat, smooth pavement
* Unique figure-8 course design
* Nine(9) turns
* Race on the bricks of Monument Circle
notes:
Held under USA Cycling permit #. All USA Cycling rules apply. Free-lap rule is in effect. Lapped riders may be pulled at the officials discretion. You must present a valid 2015 USA Cycling license at registration to enter any race. Only Category 5 men and Category 4 women may purchase a one-day license for $15 at registration. Promoter reserves the right to shorten, modify, cancel or combine any race or prize list in the event of insufficient entries or bad weather. Junior women age 15-18 Cat 4 & Cat 1/2/3 riders will be placed in their respective juniors races and also in the overall category but will be paid from the prize purse of the category in which they registered (juniors), not the overall prize purse.  All winners must be present to receive prizes/awards. Day of race registration opens at 8:00am and closes 30 minutes before the start of each race. $20 fee for each additional race. Pre-registration closes at 11:59pm EST on 7/8/15. $10 late fee applies for race day registration. Helmets required. No refunds.

Contact info: indycrit@gmail.com  / 317-459-0059

title: Lincoln Pioneer Classic
description: July 18th, 2015, Rockport Bicycle Group, Legend's - Outfitters of Active People, and Be Real Sports presents the 1st Annual Lincoln Pioneer Classic. A criterium race in Rockport City Park and Lincoln Pioneer Village. All categories of racing with additional fun races including Citizen's Class and Fixed Gear! Fun for the whole family!
course: 1/4 mile paved loop around the Rockport City Park featuring one tight corner with two sweeping turns and two small climbs.
registration: Registration through USAC online is preferred but day of registration will begin at 7:00 am CST and close at 9 :00 am CST. Riders will be able to check-in and pick up numbers until 20 minutes before their race.
notes: All start times are Central Standard Time. All USAC rules are enforced in all category's. One day licenses are $15 and are only available to cat 5 men and cat 4 women. Flat bar road bikes, mountain bikes, cruisers, and any other pedal powered bicycle is allowed in the Citizen's race. Fixed Gear bikes must complete technical inspection, be fixed gear, drop bars, and no brakes.
